article.headline: Stephen F.Austin 64, McNeese St. 39
article.story: NACOGDOCHES, Texas (AP) -- Josh Alexander scored 19 points and Stephen F. Austin held McNeese State to 30 percent shooting in a 64-39 victory Saturday night. Matt Kingsley was the other double-figure scorer for the Lumberjacks (15-2, 3-1 Southland) with 13, highlighted by 7-of-9 shooting on free throws. John Pinchon led the Cowboys (7-8, 1-2) with 13 points on 5-of-9 shooting, but the rest of the starters were just 8-of-33 from the field. Stephen F. Austin led 15-1 when McNeese finally hit its first field goal -- a 3-pointer by Diego Kapelan with 11:58 remaining in the first half. The Lumberjacks were 9-of-18 from 3-point range, led by Alexander (3-of-7) and Gerald Fonzie (3-of-6), who finished with nine points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
